dt: {bc}the opaque contractile diaphragm perforated by the pupil and forming the colored portion of the eye {dx}see {dxt|eye|eye|illustration}{/dx}
{bc}a similar device with a circular opening that can be varied in size
{bc}any of a large genus ({it}Iris{/it} of the family Iridaceae, the iris family) of perennial herbaceous plants with linear usually basal leaves and large showy flowers

et: Middle English, "iris of the eye, the plant {it}Iris germanica,{/it}" borrowed from Latin {it}īrid-, īris{/it} "rainbow, the plant {it}Iris pallida{/it} or related species," borrowed from Greek {it}īrid-, îris{/it} "rainbow, iridescent halo around the moon, a flame, etc., iris of the eye, the plant {it}Iris pallida{/it} or related species," going back to {it}*wīrid-, *wīris,{/it} of uncertain origin

Traditionally, Greek {it}îris{/it} "rainbow" (for which an original digamma [letter representing the sound {it}w{/it}] is assured by an inscription from Corinth and the metrics of epic poetry) has been regarded as a derivative of Indo-European {it}*u̯ei̯H-{/it} "plait, wrap," parallel to Germanic {it}*wīr-{/it} (see {et_link|wire:1|wire:1}). However, the variant {it}éris{/it} recorded by the Greek lexicographer Hesychius, as well as the dubious character of {it}*wīrid-{/it} as an Indo-European formation (< {it}*u̯ih{inf}1{/inf}-r-i-{/it}?) has drawn this etymology into question. Perhaps a substratal word.
shortdef: the opaque contractile diaphragm perforated by the pupil and forming the colored portion of the eye
iris diaphragm; also : a similar device with a circular opening that can be varied in size
any of a large genus (Iris of the family Iridaceae, the iris family) of perennial herbaceous plants with linear usually basal leaves and large showy flowers

dt: {bc}the Greek goddess of the rainbow and a messenger of the gods

shortdef: the Greek goddess of the rainbow and a messenger of the gods

dt: {bc}an adjustable diaphragm of thin opaque plates that can be turned by a ring so as to change the diameter of a central opening usually to regulate the aperture of a lens

shortdef: an adjustable diaphragm of thin opaque plates that can be turned by a ring so as to change the diameter of a central opening usually to regulate the aperture of a lens

dt: {bc}any of numerous wild or cultivated irises with a growth of short hairs on each fall

shortdef: any of numerous wild or cultivated irises with a growth of short hairs on each fall

dt: {bc}any of various beardless garden irises (especially {it}Iris kaempferi{/it}) with very large showy flowers

shortdef: any of various beardless garden irises (especially Iris kaempferi) with very large showy flowers
